_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Stability properties are presented of dipole and quadrupole nonradial
oscillation modes of model stars that experienced a late helium shell flash on
their way to the white-dwarf cooling domain. The computed instability domains
are compared with the observed hot variable central stars of planetary nebulae
and the GW Vir pulsators.
_source.title_of_article: On the excitation of PG1159-type pulsations

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Galactic synchrotron and free-free foregrounds angular spectra are
analytically estimated with account for interstellar turbulence and radiating
process physics. Unknown parameters of the spectra are obtained by fitting to
observational data.
_source.title_of_article: The galactic foreground angular spectra

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
A possible mechanism for screening of the surface magnetic field of an
accreting neutron star, by the accreted material, is investigated. In
particular, we investigate the nature of the evolution of the internal field
configuration in the case of a) a polar cap accretion and b) a spherical
accretion.
_source.title_of_article: Diamagnetic Screening of the Magnetic Field in Accreting Neutron Stars

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Some topics in the theory of jets are reviewed. These include jet precession,
unconfined jets, the origin of knots, the internal shock model as a unifying
theme from protostellar jets to Gamma-ray bursts, relations between the
Blandford-Znajek and MHD disk-wind models, and jet collimation in magnetic
acceleration models.
_source.title_of_article: Jets from compact objects

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We discuss the current observational and theoretical issues concerning cold
gas at high redshift and present simulations showing how a number of
observational issues can be resolved with planned future instrumentation.
_source.title_of_article: Cold Gas at High Redshift

json_location_article.value: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We compute the line strengths and profiles from a model of the cloud dynamics
of the broad and intermediate line regions and compare the results with the
observations of the Seyfert galaxy NGC 4151 in its various luminosity states.
_source.title_of_article: The Broad Line Regions of NGC 4151

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
In a recent Letter, Taras-Semchuk and Efetov reconsider the problem of
electron localization in a random magnetic field in two dimensions. They claim
that due to the long-range nature of the vector potential correlations an
additional term appears in the effective field theory ($\sigma$-model) of the
problem, leading to delocalization at the one-loop level. This calls into
question the results of earlier analytical studies, where the random magnetic
field problem was mapped onto the conventional unitary-class $\sigma$-model,
implying that the leading quantum correction is of two-loop order and of a
localizing nature. We show in this Comment, however, that the new term in fact
does not exist and was erroneously obtained by Taras-Semchuk and Efetov because
of an inconsistent treatment violating gauge invariance.
_source.title_of_article:
Comment on "Antilocalization in a 2D Electron Gas in a Random Magnetic
  Field"

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Comment on: Weak Anisotropy and Disorder Dependence of the In-Plane
Magnetoresistance in High-Mobility (100) Si Inversion Layers
_source.title_of_article:
Comment on: Weak Anisotropy and Disorder Dependence of the In-Plane
  Magnetoresistance in High-Mobility (100) Si Inversion Layers

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
This replacement corrects statement and proof of the main result. Also, a
section on the universal Abel-Jacobi map has been added.
_source.title_of_article:
Stable cohomology of the mapping class group with symplectic
  coefficients and of the universal Abel-Jacobi map

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We briefly summarize properties of quantum Hall states with a pairing or
clustering property. Their study employs a fundamental connection with
parafermionic Conformal Field Theories. We report on closed form expressions
for the many-body wave functions and on multiplicities of the fundamental
quasi-hole excitations.
_source.title_of_article: Paired and clustered quantum Hall states

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We assume the market price to diffuse in a hierarchical comb of barriers, the
heights of which represent the importance of new information entering the
market. We find fat tails with the desired exponent for the price change
distribution, and effective multifractality for intermediate times.
_source.title_of_article: Market simulation with hierarchical information flux

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We give a simplified approach to the Abhyankar--Moh theory of approximate
roots. Our considerations are based on properties of the intersection
multiplicity of local curves.
_source.title_of_article: On the approximate roots of polynomials

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
The statistical properties of time intervals between significant earthquakes
are found to be described by the Zipf-Mandelbrot-Tsallis-type distribution.
_source.title_of_article: Time Interval Distribution of Earthquakes

_source.textBody_abstract_article: Comment on A.M.Chang et al, PRL 86, 143 (2001).
_source.title_of_article:
Dependence of the Fractional Quantum Hall Edge Critical Exponent on the
  Range of Interaction

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Using simple analytical estimates we show how the physical parameters
characterizing different spectral states of the galactic black hole candidates
can be determined using spectral data presently available.
_source.title_of_article: Physical Characteristics of the Spectral States of Galactic Black Holes

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
I present new results on the extinction and on the YSO content of the
Chamaeleon I cloud using the star count method that I have implemented and
applied to DENIS and optical data. Application of this method to other nearby
Large Molecular Clouds is in progress and is briefly outlined.
_source.title_of_article:
Search for new YSOs in Large Molecular Clouds and extinction mapping
  using DENIS and optical data

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Fluctuation Theorem(FT) has been studied as far from equilibrium theorem,
which relates the symmetry of entropy production. To investigate the
application of this theorem, especially to biological physics, we consider the
FT for tilted rachet system. Under, natural assumption, FT for steady state is
derived.
_source.title_of_article: Fluctuation Theorem in Rachet System

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
In a recent letter, Alexandrov and Zavaritsky propose a model to explain the
anomalous Nernst signal observed in the normal state of hole-doped cuprates.
The aim of this comment is to recall that one of the main assumptions of the
authors regarding the experimental data is false.
_source.title_of_article:
Comment on "Nernst effect in poor conductors and in the cuprate
  superconductors"

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Original paper from Mirebeau et al. PRL 83, 628, 1999 Comment from W. Bao et
al (cond-mat/0008042, 2 Aug 2000 submitted to PRL, updated on 1 sep 2000
_source.title_of_article:
Reply to the comment on Low energy magnetic excitations of the
  Mn12-acetate spin cluster observed by neutron scattering

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
It has been proposed by Ngan [Phys. Rev. E 68, 011301 (2003)] that the
granular contact force distribution may be analytically derived by minimizing
the analog of a thermodynamic free energy, in this case consisting of the total
potential energy stored in the compressed contacts minus a particular form of
entropy weighted by a parameter. The parameter is identified as a mechanical
temperature. I argue that the particular form of entropy cannot be correct and
as a result the proposed method produces increasingly errant results for
increasing grain rigidity. This trend is evidenced in Ngan's published results
and in other numerical simulations and experiments.
_source.title_of_article:
Comment on "Mechanical analog of temperature for the description of
  force distribution in static granular packings"

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We report on new measurements of the stellar velocity dispersion of 4 BL Lac
objects for which optical spectroscopy was gathered at the ESO 3.6m using
EFOSC2. Assuming the M(BH)--(sigma) relation is valid also for ellipticals
hosting active nuclei we estimate the central BH mass of these BL Lacs.
_source.title_of_article: Mass of BL Lacs from the Velocity Dispersion of the Host Galaxy

_source.textBody_abstract_article: Paper temporarily withdrawn for remodeling
_source.title_of_article:
Absence of Fragmentation and Broken Spatial Symmetry in the Ground State
  of Dilute Bose Gases

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
The seasonal variations of extensive air showers (EAS) registered at the
Yakutsk EAS array are considered. The dependence of variations on the
atmospheric pressure is significantly expressed. The dependence on an air
temperature is not found.
_source.title_of_article:
Seasonal Variations of Extensive Air Showers with Energies from 10**17
  to 10**18 eV

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
In this paper, we discuss why and how the Planck mission, originally designed
and proposed for mapping CMB intensity fluctuations, has been revised for
polarisation measurement capability as well.
_source.title_of_article: Measuring CMB polarisation with the Planck mission

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
A stochastic dynamics framework for the study of complex systems is
presented.
_source.title_of_article: Complex systems under stochastic dynamics

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We introduce a consensus model inspired by the Sznajd Model. The updating is
synchronous and memory plays here a decisive role in making possible the
reaching of total consensus. We study the phase transition between the state
with no-consensus to the state with total consensus.
_source.title_of_article:
Phase transitions, memory and frustration in a Sznajd-like model with
  synchronous updating

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We propose a simple experiment to investigate the intercommutation of flux
tubes in type II superconductors. Using this method the intercommutation of
strings can be observed directly and the dependence of intercommutation on the
angle of crossing of strings can also be analyzed.
_source.title_of_article: Towards Observing the Intercommutation of Flux Tubes in Superconductors

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
The authors of the Letter PRL 89, 017004 (2002) predict nontrivial flux
lattice structures in UPt3 in vicinity of the superconducting transition
between the A and B phases for low magnetic fields, an important conclusion for
motivating future experiments. We show that the approach and the conclusions of
this Letter are wrong. The transitions between the different superconducting
phases in the mixed state are pointed out to be rather crossovers than real
second-order phase transitions within the most popular theoretical models of a
two-component superconducting order parameter for UPt3.
_source.title_of_article:
Comment on ``London Theory for Superconducting Phase Transitions in
  External Magnetic Fields: Application to $\text{UPt}_{3}$''

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We give a proof of a conjecture of P. Schapira and J.-P. Schneiders on the
characteristic classes of D-modules.
_source.title_of_article: Riemann-Roch theorems via deformation quantization

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Traversible wormhole space-times are found as static, spherically symmetric
solutions to the Einstein equations with ingoing and outgoing pure ghost
radiation, i.e. pure radiation with negative energy density. Switching off the
radiation causes the wormhole to collapse to a Schwarzschild black hole.
_source.title_of_article: Wormholes supported by pure ghost radiation

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
This work deals with two pressing issues in the design and operation of
Josephson qubits -- loss of coherence and measurement. (Longer abstract follows
in the work.)
_source.title_of_article: Decoherence and Quantum Measurement of Josephson-Junction Qubits

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
A nonhomogeneous universe with vacuum energy, but without spacetime
expansion, is utilized together with gravitational and Doppler redshifts as the
basis for proposing a new interpretation of the Hubble relation and the 2.7K
Cosmic Blackbody Radiation.
_source.title_of_article: A New Redshift Interpretation

terms_authors_article: E M De Gouveia Dal Pino
_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We here investigate the possibility that the ultra-high energy cosmic ray
(UHECR) events observed above the GZK limit are mostly protons accelerated in
econnection sites just above the magnetosphere of newborn millisecond pulsars
which are originated by accretion induced collapse (AIC).
_source.title_of_article:
Ultra-High-Energy Cosmic Ray Acceleration by Magnetic Reconnection in
  Newborn Pulsars

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
It is shown that 5D Kaluza-Klein theory stabilized by an external bulk scalar
field may solve the discrepant laboratory G measurements. This is achieved by
an effective coupling between gravitation and the geomagnetic field.
Experimental considerations are also addressed.
_source.title_of_article: 5D gravity and the discrepant G measurements

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We determine in closed form the general static solution with cylindrical
symmetry to the Brans-Dicke equations for an energy-momentum tensor
corresponding to the one of the straight U(1) global string outside the core
radius assuming that the Goldstone boson field takes its asymptotic value
_source.title_of_article:
Exact metric for the exterior of a global string in the Brans-Dicke
  theory

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
The sequence of phase transitions during the hot history of the universe is
followed within a phenomenological framework. Particular emphasis is put on the
QCD confinement transition, which is at reach under earth laboratory
conditions. A tepid inflationary scenario on the GUT scale with bubble grow at
moderate supercooling is discussed.
_source.title_of_article: Cosmic Phase Transitions

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We introduce and study the Wannier functions for an electron moving in a
plane under the influence of a perpendicular uniform and constant magnetic
field. The relevance for the Fractional Quantum Hall Effect is discussed; in
particular it shown that an interesting Hartree-Fock state can be constructed
in terms of Wannier functions.
_source.title_of_article: Wannier functions and Fractional Quantum Hall Effect

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We present a large catalog of $N_G \approx 200$ loose groups of galaxies
selected from the Perseus-Pisces redshift Survey.
_source.title_of_article:
A New Large Catalog of Groups of Galaxies in the Southern Galactic
  Hemisphere

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Two-imcompressible phase model of star is briefly revised. Effects of
rotation and general relativity are considered.
_source.title_of_article: Pulsations and stability of stars with phase transition

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We have measured the centroid shift of low resolution HST FOC spectra as the
dominant star changes from the Cepheid to the hot companion. With this approach
we have resolved the AW Per system and marginally resolved the U Aql system.
_source.title_of_article: A New Way to Resolve Cepheid Binaries

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
In this lecture notes will be discussed the status of the searches (i) for
classical Dirac Magnetic Monopoles (MMs) at accelerators, (ii) for GUT
superheavy MMs in the penetrating cosmic radiation and (iii) for Intermediate
Mass MMs in the cosmic radiation underground, underwater and at high altitude.
An outlook and a discussion on future searches follows.
_source.title_of_article: Magnetic Monopole Searches

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
This paper has been withdrawn by the author(s) because some experimental
results have not been checked by the last two authors.
_source.title_of_article: Superconductivity at 49 K in copper doping magnesium diboride

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We review the present status of the Baikal Neutrino Project and present the
results obtained with the deep underwater neutrino telescope NT-200.
_source.title_of_article: BAIKAL experiment: status report

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We give a brief account on the importance of surface effects from homogeneous
background charge and assess the role of numerical work for Wigner cristal
transitions. We signal work from the 1960s on the impossibility of a Wigner
Cristal thermodynamic phase and suggest a possible research direction for
investigation of cristalline electron behaviour.
_source.title_of_article: Some Aspects of Wigner Cristal Work

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
It is shown that a recent attempt to derive the Meissner effect from first
principles in a model field theory is invalid.
_source.title_of_article:
Comment on ``Anomaly-Induced Magnetic Screening in (2+1) Dimensional QED
  at Finite Density"

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Methanol masers and molecular shock tracers were observed in the
W3(OH)/W3(H$_2$O) region with the BIMA array and the Onsala 20m radiotelescope.
Characteristics of the outflows in the region are discussed. A model of the
W3(OH) methanol maser formation region is constructed.
_source.title_of_article: Masers and Outflows in the W3(OH)/W3(H2O) region

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
The conceptual basis for the nonlocality of accelerated systems is presented.
The nonlocal theory of accelerated observers and its consequences are briefly
described. Nonlocal field equations are developed for the case of the
electrodynamics of linearly accelerated systems.
_source.title_of_article: Nonlocality of Accelerated Systems

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
To extract information about polarized gluon distribution in the proton,
charmed hadron, actually \Lambda_c^+, productions at RHIC experiment are
studied. We found that the spin correlation asymmetry between the initial
proton and the produced \Lambda_c^+ is enable us to distinguish
parameterization models of polarized gluons.
_source.title_of_article: Charmed Hadron Production at RHIC

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
\EcoLab{} is an agent based modeling system for C++ programmers, strongly
influenced by the design of Swarm. This paper is just a brief outline of
\EcoLab's features, more details can be found in other published articles,
documentation and source code from the \EcoLab{} website.
_source.title_of_article: EcoLab: Agent Based Modeling for C++ programmers

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
This article presents an implementation of a graphical software with various
algorithms in Operations research, like minimum path, minimum tree, chinese
postman problem and travelling salesman.
_source.title_of_article:
Estudo e Implementacao de Algoritmos de Roteamento sobre Grafos em um
  Sistema de Informacoes Geograficas

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Double-exchange model in infinite dimension is studied as the strong Hund's
coupling limit $J\to\infty$ of the Kondo lattice model. Several quantities such
as Green's function and the d.c.\ conductivity are calculated in analytical
forms. Magnetoresistance in lightly doped (La,Sr)MnO$_3$ is reproduced very
well.
_source.title_of_article: Magnetoresistance of the Double-Exchange Model in Infinite Dimension

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Magnon linewidth of La_1.2 Sr_1.8 Mn_2 O_7 near the Brillouin zone boundary
is investigated from both theoretical and experimental points of view. Abrupt
magnon broadening is ascribed to a strong magnon-phonon coupling. Magnon
broadening observed in cubic perovskite manganites is also discussed.
_source.title_of_article:
Magnon Broadening Effects in Double Layered Manganite La_1.2 Sr_1.8 Mn_2
  O_7

_source.textBody_abstract_article: The role of R in the solutions of the Ginsparg-Wilson relation is discussed.
_source.title_of_article: A note on the solutions of the Ginsparg-Wilson relation

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Numerical results for Anderson transition are critically discussed. A simple
procedure to deal with corrections to scaling is suggested. With real
uncertainties taken into account, the raw data are in agreement with a value
$\nu=1$ for the critical index of the correlation length in three dimensions.
_source.title_of_article:
Critical indices of Anderson transition: something is wrong with
  numerical results

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
The paper (as posted originally) contains several errors. It has been
subsequently split into two papers, the corrected (and accepted for
publication) versions appear in the archive as papers cs.CC/0503082 and
cs.DM/0503083.
_source.title_of_article: Phase Transitions and all that

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
For an asymptotically hyperbolic metric on the interior of a compact manifold
with boundary, we prove that the resolvent and scattering operators are
continuous functions of the metric in the appropriate topologies.
_source.title_of_article: Scattering theory and deformations of asymptotically hyperbolic metrics

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
A short review of theoretical and experimental results on fragmentation in
e^+e^- annihilation is presented. Starting with an introduction of the concept
of fragmentation functions in e^+e^- annihilation, aspects of scaling
violation, multiplicities, small and large x, longitudinal, gluon, light and
heavy quark fragmentation are summarized.
_source.title_of_article: Jet fragmentation in e^+e^- annihilation

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We give a Hamiltonian definition of mass for spacelike hypersurfaces in
space-times with metrics which are asymptotic to the anti-de Sitter one, or to
a class of generalizations thereof. We show that our definition provides a
geometric invariant for a spacelike hypersurface embedded in a space-time.
_source.title_of_article:
The mass of spacelike hypersurfaces in asymptotically anti-de Sitter
  space-times

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Recent progress in neutrino physics has been rapid, to a large extent thanks
to observations of neutrinos produced in astrophysical environments. Here, we
review the current standing on such questions as neutrino masses and mixings,
focusing mainly on the interplay between neutrino physics, astrophysics and
cosmology.
_source.title_of_article: Recent Progress in Neutrino Astrophysics

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
This is a comment on recent paper by T.M. Stace and S.D. Barrett, PRL 92,
136802 (2004). We show that the main result of the paper, absence of the
spectral peak for continuous weak measurement of coherent oscillations in a
qubit, is incorrect.
_source.title_of_article:
Comment on "Continuous quantum measurement: inelastic tunneling and lack
  of current oscillations"

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We investigate the implications of large N_c and chiral symmetry for the mass
spectra of meson resonances. Unlike for most other mesons, the mass matrix of
the light scalars deviates strongly from its large-N_c limit. We discuss the
possible assignments for the lightest scalar nonet that survives in the
large-N_c limit.
_source.title_of_article: Meson resonances, large N_c and chiral symmetry

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Presented at the 1992 Meeting of the DPF, Fermilab. The electroweak phase
transition is reviewed in light of some recent developments. Emphasis is on the
issue whether the transition is first or second order and its possible role in
the generation of the baryon asymmetry of the universe.
_source.title_of_article: Aspects of the Electroweak Phase Transition

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
This paper has been removed by arXiv administrators because it plagiarizes
P.K. Jena, P.C. Naik and T. Pradhan, "Photon As The Zero Mass Limit Of Dkp
Field," J. Phys. A 13, 2975 (1980) [not cited within submission]. In addition,
the following submissions by the authors and their collaborators all contain a
great deal of overlap: gr-qc/0502059, gr-qc/0502061, gr-qc/0207026,
hep-th/0110228, and hep-th/0207088.
_source.title_of_article:
On the Equivalence of the Massless DKP equation and the Maxwell
  Equations in the Shuwer

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Accurate limits for the violation of the Principle of Equivalence have been
found from the comparison of the redshifts of two identical nuclear species in
different chemical environments.
_source.title_of_article: M\"o\ss{}bauer null redshift experiment II

_source.textBody_abstract_article: This article has been replaced by gr-qc/0412011
_source.title_of_article:
Relating Spin Foams and Canonical Quantum Gravity: A Discrete Step
  Evolution Formulation of Spin Foams

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Theoretical expectations for direct and indirect searches for relic
neutralinos are presented. Complementarity among various investigation means is
discussed in connection with the values of the neutralino relic abundance.
_source.title_of_article: Searching for Relic Neutralinos

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
The assumption that the ratio of the Higgs self-coupling to the square of its
yukawa coupling to the top is (almost) independent of the renormalization scale
fixes the Higgs mass within narrow limits at m=160 GeV using only the values of
gauge couplings and top mass.
_source.title_of_article: A Calculation of Higgs Mass in the Standard Model

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We demonstrate that the R-parity breaking interactions within their current
experimental upper bounds can give rise to large mixing-induced CP asymmetry in
exclusive radiative B decays that may be detectable in the upcoming B
factories.
_source.title_of_article:
Large CP violation in radiative B decays in supersymmetry without
  R-parity

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
The history of VLBI is summarized with emphasis on the technical aspects. A
summary of VLBI systems which are in use is given, and an outlook to the future
of VLBI instrumentation.
_source.title_of_article: A Review of VLBI Instrumentation

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
I give an outline and some discussion of the results presented during the
hadronic final states parallel sessions of the meeting, and some opinions about
the current state of play and future directions in this area.
_source.title_of_article: Studying QCD in the Final State of High Energy Collisions

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Using the Bryant representation, we define a new flux on homology classes of
CMC-1 surfaces in hyperbolic 3-space, satisfying a balancing formula which is
useful to show nonexistencd of certain kinds of complete CMC-1 surfaces.
_source.title_of_article:
A new flux for mean curvature 1 surfaces in hyperbolic 3-space, and
  applications

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
It is known that the gravitational collapse of a dust ball results in naked
singularity formation from an initial density profile which is physically
reasonable. In this paper, we show that explosive radiation is emitted during
the formation process of the naked singularity.
_source.title_of_article: Naked Singularity Explosion

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
I review the current status of our knowledge of CP violation and flavor
physics. I discuss where one should look for future improvements, and outline
the experimental and theoretical priorities of the field.
_source.title_of_article: Flavor Physics and the CKM Matrix: An Overview

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
The Bardeen model -- the first regular black hole model in General Relativity
-- is reinterpreted as the gravitational field of a nonlinear magnetic
monopole, i.e., as a magnetic solution to Einstein equations coupled to a
nonlinear electrodynamics.
_source.title_of_article: The Bardeen Model as a Nonlinear Magnetic Monopole

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
The quantization of gravitational waves in the Milne universe is discussed.
The relation between positive frequency functions of the gravitational waves in
the Milne universe and those in the Minkowski universe is clarified.
Implications to the one-bubble open inflation scenario are also discussed.
_source.title_of_article: Quantized gravitational waves in the Milne universe

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
In this paper we give a detailed proof of a result we announced a year ago.
This result is an effective version of the theorem of Mazur-Kamienny-Merel
concerning uniform bounds for rational torsion points on elliptic curves over
number fields.
_source.title_of_article:
Bornes effectives pour la torsion des courbes elliptiques sur les corps
  de nombres

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
At the Fermilab Tevatron, the CDF and D0 detectors are being used to study
diboson production in $p\bar{p}$ collisions at $\sqrt{s}=1.96$ TeV. We
summarize recent measurements of the W$\gamma$, Z$\gamma$, and WW
cross-sections and limits on WZ and ZZ production. Limits on anomalous
trilinear gauge couplings are also presented.
_source.title_of_article: Diboson Physics at the Tevatron

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Hypernuclear physics plays a decisive role for several features of compact
star physics. I review the impact of hypernuclear potential depths, two-body
hyperon-nucleon and hyperon three-body forces as well as hyperon-hyperon
interactions on the maximum mass, the mass-radius relation, and cooling
properties of neutron stars.
_source.title_of_article: Hypernuclear Physics and Compact Stars

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
This report on Photon Colliders briefly reviews three main issues: physics
motivation, possible parameters and technical feasibility, plans of works and
international cooperation. New scheme of laser optics at the interaction region
is described which can drastically (at least by one order) reduce the cost of
the laser system.
_source.title_of_article: Status of gamma-gamma, gamma-electron colliders

_source.textBody_abstract_article: We withdraw the paper because the results are wrong.
_source.title_of_article: Spin Hall Conductance in Disordered Two-Dimensional Electron Systems

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
The singular bifurcations in a dispersive billiard are discussed in terms of
symbolic dynamics and is compared to an example of a bifurcation tree in a
smooth potential. Possible generalizations to other smooth potentials are
discussed.
_source.title_of_article: Symbolic dynamics III. Bifurcations in billiards and smooth potentials

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
In this work we study the finite temperature SU(2) gauge theory with
staggered fermions for real and imaginary chemical potential. We test the
method of analytical continuation of Monte Carlo results obtained for imaginary
chemical potential, by comparison with those obtained {\em directly} for real
chemical potential.
_source.title_of_article: Finite temperature 2-color QCD for real and imaginary chemical potential

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
In a recent paper [1] Lineweaver and Davis performed a statistical analysis
to claim that the rapidity of biogenesis on Earth indicates high probability of
biogenesis on terrestrial- type planets. We argue that the rapid appearance of
life on Earth hardly tells us anything about the probability of life to appear
on other planet. The conclusion should be different. The rapid initial
biogenesis is consistent with a large number ($N \sim 10$) of crucial steps in
evolution from simplest life forms to humans.
_source.title_of_article:
Comment on "Does the rapid appearence of life on Earth suggest that life
  is common in the Universe"

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Expressions for Sudakov form factors for heavy quarks are presented. They are
used to construct resummed jet rates in electron-positron annihilation.
Predictions are given for production of bottom quarks at LEP and top quarks at
the Linear Collider.
_source.title_of_article: Resummed jet rates with heavy quarks in electron-positron collisions

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
In a recent paper, Farrar and Biermann argue that there is a strong
correlation between the direction of the five highest-energy cosmic-ray events
and compact, radio-loud quasars. This Comment shows that this analysis contains
several inconsistencies and errors so that the significance of any such
correlation is certainly greatly overestimated and perhaps nonexistent.
_source.title_of_article:
Comment on "Correlation between Compact Radio Lout Quasars and Ultrahigh
  Energy Cosmic Rays"

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We calculate the $\bar{s}s$ condensate in the D - and B - mesons using the
unquenched hopping parameter expansion at infinite coupling for the Wilson
lattice action. We discuss the phenomenological relevance of our result.
_source.title_of_article: The $\bar{s}s$ content of the D-meson at infinite coupling

json_location_article.value: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We present some results on renormalization and factorization scale dependence
of soft-gluon resummation, at the next-to-leading-logarithmic level, in the
fixed-target hadro-production cross-section for prompt photons.
_source.title_of_article: Results in next-to-leading-log prompt-photon hadroproduction

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We discuss the underlying connections among the thermodynamic properties of
short-ranged spin glasses, their behavior in large finite volumes, and the
interfaces that separate different pure states, and also ground states and
low-lying excitations.
_source.title_of_article: Finite-Dimensional Spin Glasses: States, Excitations, and Interfaces

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We introduce a class of improved actions for staggered fermions which to
O(p^4) and O(p^6), respectively, lead to rotationally invariant propagators. We
discuss the resulting reduction of flavour symmetry breaking in the meson
spectrum and comment on the improvement in the calculation of thermodynamic
observables.
_source.title_of_article: Staggered Fermion Actions with Improved Rotational Invariance

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
It is shown that the recently proposed interpretation of the transposed
equi-affine theory of gravity as a theory with variable Plank "constant" is
inconsistent with basic solar system gravitational experiments.
_source.title_of_article:
Solar System Experiments and the Interpretation of Saa's Model of
  Gravity with Propagating Torsion as a Theory with Variable Plank "Constant"

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
A short review of recent theoretical results on the Deep Inelastic Scattering
is presented.
_source.title_of_article: Evolution of DIS structure functions at small x

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We present different bit-string models of haploid asexual populations in
which individuals may exchange part of their genome with other individuals
(parasex) according to a given probability. We study the advantages of this
parasex concerning population sizes, genetic fitness and diversity. We find
that the exchange of genomes always improves these features.
_source.title_of_article: Bit-String Models for Parasex

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
I derive a single factorization formula which summarizes all soft and
collinear divergences of a tree-level gauge theory amplitude. The singular
factor squared is in a certain sense the generalization of the Catani-Seymour
dipole factorization formula.
_source.title_of_article: Antenna Factorization of Gauge-Theory Amplitudes

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
As part of a systematic algorithm study, we present first results on a
performance comparison between a multibosonic algorithm and the hybrid Monte
Carlo algorithm as employed by the SESAM collaboration. The standard Wilson
fermion action is used on 32*16^3 lattices at beta=5.5.
_source.title_of_article: The Quest for Light Sea Quarks: Algorithms for the Future

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
I summarize the scientific goals and current status of the Sloan Digital Sky
Survey, briefly describe the Early Data Release, and discuss some recent
scientific results obtained from commissioning data which are apposite to the
distribution of luminous and dark matter in the Universe.
_source.title_of_article: Tracing luminous and dark matter with the Sloan Digital Sky Survey

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
We present our view of the main physical ingredients determining the
evolution of neutron star magnetic fields. This includes the basic properties
of neutron star matter, possible scenarios for the origin of the magnetic
field, constraints and mechanisms for its evolution, and a discussion of our
recent work on the Hall drift.
_source.title_of_article: Magnetic fields in neutron stars: A theoretical perspective

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
In the first lecture we review the current status of local supersymmetry. In
the second lecture we focus on D=11 supergravity as the low-energy limit of
M-theory and pose the questions: (1) What are the D=11 symmetries? (2) How many
supersymmetries can M-theory vacua preserve?
_source.title_of_article: Erice lectures on "The status of local supersymmetry"

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
In this note we present a review of the little Higgs models that stabilize
the electroweak by realizing the Standard Model Higgs as a pseudo-Goldstone
boson.
_source.title_of_article: Little Higgs Models: New Approaches to the Hierarchy Problem

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Recent results for charm quark mass effects in perturbative bottom quark mass
determinations from $\Upsilon$ mesons are reviewed. The connection between the
behavior of light quark mass corrections and the infrared sensitivity of some
bottom quark mass definitions is examined in some detail.
_source.title_of_article: Light Quark Mass Effects in Bottom Quark Mass Determinations

_source.textBody_abstract_article:
Transverse momentum imbalance between a jet produced with a hard photon is
considered as a signal of medium-induced partonic energy loss in
ultrarelativistic heavy ion collisions. We analyze photon-jet correlation in
the context of a real experimental situation at the LHC, the problem of neutral
pion background being discussed.
_source.title_of_article: Photon-jet correlation in heavy ion collisions at the LHC
